means: 使湿透( drench的现在分词 )
在某人（某物）上大量使用（某液体）

sentence.Network_en: He uncoiled the hose and gave them a thorough drenching.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把软管铺展开来，把它们彻底冲洗了一下。

sentence.Network_en: I reached Kilmarnock in the early morning in drenching rain.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一大早就冒着瓢泼大雨到了基尔曼诺克。

sentence.Network_en: The three of us set off, our wheels skidding crazily under that drenching rain.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们三个出发了，车轮在大雨中疯狂地打滑。

entry.def: To drench something or someone means to make them completely wet.

example.ex: They turned fire hoses on the people and drenched them...
example.tran: 他们将消防水管对着人们，把他们浇了个透。

example.ex: They were getting drenched by icy water...
example.tran: 他们被冰冷的水浇透了。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of making something completely wet;

auth_sentence.content: Wales was also forecast to get a drenching.
auth_sentence.res_content: Wales was also forecast to get a drenching.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wales was also forecast to get a drenching.

auth_sentence.content: The badly bleeding wound in my right thigh drenching my trousers.
auth_sentence.res_content: The badly bleeding wound in my right thigh drenching my trousers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The badly bleeding wound in my right thigh drenching my trousers.

auth_sentence.content: Ending with a drenching from a bucket of cold water on a rope, it was impossible not to feel vigorously alive.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ending with a drenching from a bucket of cold water on a rope, it was impossible not to feel vigorously alive.
